chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Reginald A Felzkowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.

miscConds.notes: Fine and costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.
Defendant shall attend counseling/programing as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.

  The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement agent without cause.
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant granted credit for 2 days served and is specifically denied huber priveleges. It is the Court's intention that the defendant begin his sentence on12-24-2014 at 7AM and is to be released on 12-28-2014 at 
7 pm irregardless if this adds up to the 5 days according to the Jail's calculations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reginald A Felzkowski

Plea/sentencing hearing on October 30, 2014 at 10:20 am.

Richard Lewis appeared for the State;  Defendant appeared in person with Attorney Kuczynski  Defendant acknowledges receipt of the Information  Waived reading of Information  THE DEFENDANT ENTERED A PLEA OF NOT GUILTY
Prosecutor, Richard R. Lewis, and Defendant, Reginald A Felzkowski, appeared with Attorney Christine Kuczynski. Preliminary waived  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 30, 2014 at 10:20 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 23, 2014 at 11:10 am.

Prosecutor, Richard R. Lewis, and Defendant, Reginald A Felzkowski, appeared with Attorney Christine Kuczynski. Defense requests preliminary hearing  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 23, 2014 at 11:10 am.

Pre-trial conference on August 5, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on August 28, 2014 at 10:10 am.

Prosecutor, Richard R. Lewis, and Defendant, Reginald A Felzkowski, appeared with Attorney Christine Kuczynski.  Waived reading of the complaint  Waived time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 5, 2014 at 11:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for August 28, 2014 at 10:10 am.
Initial appearance on July 24, 2014 at 02:50 pm.

Defendant is not to drive any motorized vehicle: (a) unless defendant is in possession of a valid Wisconsin operator's license for the type of motor vehicle being driven; (b) defendant and such motor vehicle are insured as required by law; and (c) defendant is in possession of valid proof of insurance while operating the motor vehicle.    Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises. Specifically defendant is not to go to any festivals.      The defendant shall have no contact with  B.T. of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;  Defendant appeared in person, pro se,  via video conference from Clark County Jail  Defendant advised of right to an attorney  Initial appearance scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 02:50 pm.
